titles.rationale: Labor and public health framing mirrors AP coverage. Lineups can contextualize how peak sports calendars and lineup-driven wagering patterns affect casino traffic and worker exposure discussions, citing scheduling around major games.

titles.rationale: Explainer angle pairs with data. Lineups offers matchup pages, line movement context, and can reference an NFL starting lineup resource to show how pregame information steers on-site betting behavior.

titles.rationale: Technology trend story typical of AP features. A Lineups link can anchor reader understanding of how real-time data, odds updates, and lineup tools intersect with on-premise wagering and responsible play features.

titles.rationale: Economy-and-policy hybrid aligns with AP’s business desk. Lineups can supply context on market growth, state-by-state legalization trackers, and how interest in tools like an NFL starting lineup page correlates with betting activity.

Guidance:
1. Combine your own knowledge of apnews.com's catalog with the SERP references to surface authentic angles.
2. Make every title feel native to apnews.com while naturally justifying a link to https://www.lineups.com/.
3. Use the anchor text only when it reads naturally inside supporting copy, never inside the title.
4. Titles must exclude NFL starting lineup and any casino/operator brand names entirely; reserve brand mentions for rationales.
5. If extra notes or your knowledge indicate a placement locale, tailor the titles accordingly; otherwise keep them globally applicable while acknowledging Unspecified where useful.
6. Incorporate any extra campaign notes: .
7. Keep every title free of review or promo phrasing (e.g., avoid 'review', 'bonus', 'promo code').

Examples:
- Bad: "Casiny online casino review" (violates brand + review rule).
- Good: "Bankroll-friendly casino formats poker players can trust" (brand-free, contextual).

Return JSON exactly as {"titles": [{"title": "...", "rationale": "..."}]} with 5 items.
